qas.question: What work did Hayek begin in 1923?
Where did Carl Menger and Friedrich von Wieser influence Hayek?
For whom did Hayek work upon being hired by Ludwig von Mises?
What was Hayek gathering during his time as a research assistant?
What was the name of the professor Hayek worked for as a research assistant?

context: During Hayek's years at the <a1_0>University of Vienna<a1_0/>, Carl Menger's work on the explanatory strategy of social science and Friedrich von Wieser's commanding presence in the classroom left a lasting influence on him. Upon the completion of his examinations, Hayek was hired by Ludwig von Mises on the recommendation of Wieser as a specialist for <a2_0>the Austrian government<a2_0/> working on the legal and economic details of the Treaty of Saint Germain. Between 1923 and 1924 Hayek worked as a <a0_0>research assistant<a0_0/> to Prof. <a4_0>Jeremiah Jenks<a4_0/> of New York University, compiling <a3_0>macroeconomic data<a3_0/> on the American economy and the operations of the US Federal Reserve.
